FCCEUD-28: Describe how to view a rendered preview of a module

Issue ID: FCCEUD-28
Issue Link: https://projects.engineering.redhat.com/browse/FCCEUD-28

* Create module "Previewing modules in pantheon"

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure we need to include 'as logged-in user' in the title here - you've called that out nice and clearly in the text itself, and the general task we're attempting to perform is previewing a module. Being logged in is a detail of that, and if we included it in the title, readers might think there are other procedures for different variations.
timeline.author: adahms
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,22 @@
+include::../attributes.adoc[]
+[id="previewing-modules-in-pantheon_{context}"]
+= Previewing modules in {ProductShortName} as logged-in user

timeline.author: adahms
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,22 @@
+include::../attributes.adoc[]
+[id="previewing-modules-in-pantheon_{context}"]
+= Previewing modules in {ProductShortName} as logged-in user
+
+Preview a module that has been imported in {ProductShortName}.
+
+.Prerequisites
+* You are logged in.
++
+If you are not logged in, you can still see the rendered module if it is already published to the customer portal.
+
+* The module to be previewed has been imported in {ProductShortName}.
+
+.Procedure
+. Navigate to the link:{LinkToSearchPage}[Search page].
+. Click the name of the module you want to preview.
++
+If you don't see the module listed, search for the modules using the search box.
